intro: Hieracium collicola, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium collicola is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude conditions.
